Project Description
An experiment in using WPF custom drawing to emulate a basic oscilloscope that can plot Lissajous curves (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lissajous_curve).

Design
The X and Y functions are sampled at 5KHz using a System.Timers.Timer with correction applied for jitter (using a high performance timebase) which allow higher software sample resolution than normal. Although fixed to use sinusoidal functions the function parameters can be adjusted using WPF / MVVM binding. Circular buffers are used to limit GC pressure.

The scope is rendered using a custom WPF control with buffered geometries for performance. The display is painted at 50Hz independently of the sampler.
